alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Fergus; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Judith Basin, western Fergus and southern Chouteau Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Geyser, or 12 miles northwest of Stanford, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Geyser. This includes Highway 200 between mile markers 17 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm has already produced up to a half inch of rainfall, so minor flooding of poor drainage areas may begin shortly. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and north central Montana.
